intro: Cardiandra moellendorffii, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. Its inflorescence consists of numerous small florets arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Cardiandra moellendorffii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
